page.title: 02FARMING 1
page.content: The farms in the area are mainly owned by families and range from{6 {acres to 135 acres}in size. The height above sea level results in{heavy rainfall, late springs}and{ {early winters}and wind.All these restrict the kinds of crops that can be grown. The soil in the area is best for{ {growing grass}so this is primarily what the farmers do.The grass is used to feed cows and sheep.It is also cut for hay and silage which feeds the animals in winter. The cows are kept as{dairy}-producing milk which is sold to the milk marketing board and also for young beasts. The{sheep}are kept for the lambs they produce which are then sold at local markets. Two farms kept{poultry}and{pigs.}
